content: Singaporean politician (1940–2020) **Saidi bin Shariff** (1940 – 14 January 2020) was a Singaporean politician belonging to [People's Action Party](/wiki/People%27s_Action_Party). He was a member of the [Parliament of Singapore](/wiki/Parliament_of_Singapore). ## Biography Saidi was a founding member of Yayasan Mendaki which is a self-help group. He received secondary education in Raffles Institution from 1955 to 1958. In the sixties he worked at the National Community Leadership Training Institute. He was elected as a member of the [Parliament of Singapore](/wiki/Parliament_of_Singapore) from [Kaki Bukit](/wiki/Kaki_Bukit_Single_Member_Constituency) in 1980. After his parliamentary career, Saidi started to take classes for young leaders. Later, he received a postgraduate degree from the [University of Hull](/wiki/University_of_Hull) at the age of 56. He retired as an assistant director from Yayasan Mendaki in 2002. Saidi died on 14 January 2020 at the age of 79. This article about a politician from Singapore is a stub. You can help Wikipedia by expanding it. - v - t - e
title: Saidi Shariff
